scenario: My friend just went through a breakup. What should I say to them?
options: Offer to listen and be there for them
Tell them to get over it and move on
Ignore the situation and change the subject
Tell them it's their fault and they deserved it
Tell them they should never trust anyone again

scenario: My partner is upset with me. How can I resolve the situation?
options: Apologize and ask for forgiveness
Blame them for overreacting
Avoid the issue and hope it goes away
Tell them they are overreacting
Break up with them

scenario: My sibling is going through a tough time. How can I support them?
options: Offer to spend time with them and listen
Tell them to toughen up and stop complaining
Ignore their problems and focus on yourself
Tell them they brought it upon themselves
Tell them to deal with it on their own

scenario: My friend is considering dropping out of college. What advice should I give them?
options: Encourage them to explore their options and make an informed decision
Tell them they are making a huge mistake and will regret it
Dismiss their concerns and tell them college is not important
Tell them they are not smart enough for college
Tell them to drop out immediately

scenario: My parent is pressuring me to choose a specific career path. What should I do?
options: Communicate your interests and concerns to your parent
Ignore their opinion and do what you want
Agree to their demands to avoid conflict
Tell them they are wrong and don't understand
Cut off all contact with them

scenario: My friend is struggling with their mental health. How can I support them?
options: Encourage them to seek professional help and offer to accompany them
Tell them to just snap out of it and stop being dramatic
Minimize their struggles and tell them it's not a big deal
Blame them for their own mental health issues
Tell them to isolate themselves and avoid seeking help

scenario: My partner wants to try a new hobby. How can I show support?
options: Encourage them to pursue their new hobby and offer to join them
Tell them their new hobby is a waste of time and money
Ignore their new hobby and focus on your own interests
Tell them they will never succeed in their new hobby
Discourage them from pursuing their new hobby

scenario: My friend is considering ending a toxic friendship. What advice should I give them?
options: Support their decision and offer to help them through the process
Tell them they are overreacting and should give their friend another chance
Minimize the toxicity and tell them it's not that bad
Blame them for the toxic friendship and say it's their fault
Tell them to continue the toxic friendship

scenario: My sibling wants to move to a different city. How can I show support?
options: Encourage them to pursue their dreams and offer help with the move
Tell them they are making a huge mistake and should stay
Dismiss their plans and tell them it's not worth it
Tell them they will fail in the new city
Convince them to stay and abandon their plans

scenario: My friend is struggling with their weight. How can I support them?
options: Offer to exercise together and provide healthy meal options
Tell them they are fat and need to lose weight
Ignore their weight concerns and change the subject
Blame them for their weight issues and say it's their fault
Tell them they will never be able to lose weight

scenario: My partner wants to try a new hairstyle. How can I show support?
options: Encourage them to experiment with their hair and offer compliments
Tell them their new hairstyle looks terrible
Ignore their new hairstyle and don't comment on it
Tell them they will look ridiculous with the new hairstyle
Persuade them not to change their hairstyle

scenario: My friend is considering quitting their job. What advice should I give them?
options: Listen to their concerns and offer support in their decision
Tell them they are being irresponsible and should stay
Dismiss their job dissatisfaction and tell them to suck it up
Blame them for their job problems and say it's their fault
Tell them to quit immediately without considering the consequences

scenario: My parent wants me to follow in their footsteps career-wise. What should I do?
options: Communicate your own career aspirations and goals to your parent
Ignore their wishes and pursue your own path
Agree to their demands to avoid conflict
Tell them they are wrong and don't understand
Cut off all contact with them

scenario: My friend is considering getting back together with their ex. What advice should I give them?
options: Listen to their reasons and offer support in their decision
Tell them their ex is a terrible person and they should never go back
Minimize the issues in their previous relationship and tell them to give it another chance
Blame them for the problems in their previous relationship
Tell them to get back together without considering the consequences

options: Listen to their reasons and offer support in their decision
Tell them they are making a huge mistake and will regret it
Dismiss their concerns and tell them college is not important
Tell them they are not smart enough for college
Tell them to drop out immediately

scenario: My friend is feeling insecure about their appearance. How can I support them?
options: Offer compliments and remind them of their positive qualities
Tell them they are ugly and need to change their appearance
Ignore their insecurities and change the subject
Blame them for their own insecurities and say it's their fault
Tell them they will never be attractive
